subject: Nineteen Hundred Eighties
Baseball
lead_paragraph: The death of Frank Cashen, the general manager of the Mets in the 1980s, recalls how good the Mets teams of his era generally were and how they became the dominant franchise in New York sports.
snippet: The death of Frank Cashen, the general manager of the Mets in the 1980s, recalls how good the Mets teams of his era generally were and how they became the dominant franchise in New York sports.
